glsa.title: MIT Kerberos 5: Multiple local privilege escalation vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Some applications shipped with MIT Kerberos 5 are vulnerable to local privilege escalation.

background.p: MIT Kerberos 5 is a suite of applications that implement the Kerberos network protocol. It is designed to provide strong authentication for client/server applications by using secret-key cryptography.

description.p: Unchecked calls to setuid() in krshd and v4rcp, as well as unchecked calls to seteuid() in kftpd and in ksu, have been found in the MIT Kerberos 5 program suite and may lead to a local root privilege escalation.

impact.p: A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
